stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
This Sarkaz swordmaster is a rare creature at Rhodes Island. Many operators and staff give Flamebringer a wide berth. 
Most of the time, Flamebringer is a man of few words, prefers to stay by himself, and shows his personal feelings only to the Doctor. At that point, he seems like a completely different person. But behind the arrogant attitude he puts up for the Doctor, there appears to be another side of Flamebringer waiting for something, or perhaps expecting something. 
After witnessing Flamebringer take a few lives, one must admit that the bloodthirsty madness of the swordmaster is indeed formidable, and of tremendous use on the battlefield. But the duality of this individual is striking, and we must be wary of the relationship between Operator Flamebringer and the Doctor.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Rhodes Island is home to a wealth of combat experience, including some warriors so deep in the fight they struggle to ever leave the battlefield. But Flamebringer does not fit neatly into the roster. His combat skills are second to none, certainly. But he has never seen victory as a goal to be won. He enjoys the process and excitement of taking lives for its own sake. 
The use of the word "commitment" with regard to battle is quite peculiar, but Flamebringer's fighting style does give the impression that he is fully committed to the art. Only when facing the razor thin line between life and death will he ever crack a smile. To Flamebringer, that moment is the ecstasy one lives for.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Due to the peculiar nature of this operator, human resources opted to conduct an investigation into his past. 
There is no doubt that the list of names Flamebringer provided himself is significantly understated. Each name on the list is a person of great importance, with the capacity to personally swing the fate of a battle. In other words, if Flamebringer did indeed take these lives, then his past is far more complicated than we ever imagined. It is necessary for us to conduct a deeper investigation and reevaluate Flamebringer's position as a Rhodes Island Operator. 

End of record: Dr. Kal'tsit but a stop to the second round of investigations. She believes the Doctor is capable of managing the Flamebringer situation at this point. If he chose to bury his past, digging it up will only cause problems. 
Or perhaps the people and events that have been buried simply have not yet had their time to reemerge into the story.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
As his time with Rhodes Island grew, we came to know that Flamebringer quite enjoys gardening, cultivating potted plants and flowers. It was quite surprising to learn he held on to such "interests." 
Most operators never have a chance to learn about Flamebringer's inner self, and chalk these things up to a kind of "contrast": a deadly swordmaster returns from the battlefield to care for his flowers. That's it. 
But of course, it may truly be that simple. That Flamebringer treats these plants, himself, his allies, his enemies, and all living beings with the exact same, unified attitude. We must first gain an understanding of this before we can truly understand Flamebringer. 
Perhaps this is the reason Flamebringer regards both himself and his enemies so fleetingly. From this perspective, his cold and arrogant attitude may stem from an internal philosophy regarding the nature of life itself.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText: A true warrior knows no fear of death. He will challenge the limits of life itself again and again, in search of the depths of his own heart, in search of eternal glory, and in search of the greatest skill. The same is true for Flamebringer. He wields his two blades to expand the edges of his destiny. As for why he is so obsessed with this pursuit, perhaps it is to explore the meaning of life itself at this conflict-riddled moment in history. I certainly hope that is it.
stories.unLockString: Promote to Elite 2 for more info

stories.storyText:
[Codename] Executor
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] 5 years
[Place of Birth] Laterano
[Date of Birth] July 7
[Race] Sankta
[Height] 181cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed uninfected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skills] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Executor is a citizen of Laterano, serving as an executor of the Laterano Notarial Hall, responsible for applying Rights of the Laterano Citizen numbered One through Thirteen. He is well versed in many languages and legal frameworks. 
Executor has been contracted to Rhodes Island, where he executes functions related to the rights of Laterano citizens.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there are no other signs of infection. At this time, this operator can be confirmed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Executor shows no signs of Oripathy infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density]0.13u/L
Has anyone researched the correlation between interpersonal relationships and crystal density? Maybe we should do this as our next task? 
--Medic Operator T.O.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
The Laterano Notarial Hall is one of the official organs of Laterano state power. On the one hand, the Hall imposes fees on the citizens of Laterano, urging them to perform various legal obligations, including but not limited to management of estate property, childrearing and guardianship, and execution of notarized contracts; On the other hand, the Hall also performs various services guaranteeing the rights and benefits of Laterano citizenship. 
As such, the Notarial Hall requires a diverse and unique staff. Civil servants are dispatched to various city-states to supervise, execute, and oversee official functions. 
Operator Executor is one such employee. They are known as "executors," and carry out the will of the Laterano Notarial Hall.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
The records of the Notarial Hall are open, fair, and transparent. Honestly, upon first inspecting Executor's records and commission, the human resources department found it quite ordinary. 
"October 12: the designated property was delivered to the appropriate heir. 
March 5: the company that violated the notarized contract was shuttered. 
June 2: Moneys disbursed by the appropriate party in accordance with the contract. 
July 9: In accordance with the wishes of the citizens..."
The majority of the tasks performed by Executor were mundane, if not boring, suitable for a low-level bureaucrat. 
In fact, 41 non-Laterano citizens died in the course of executing the first item (all had been sentenced to death or greater than 200 years in prison), while six civilian buildings were damaged in the execution of the second item. The third item saw the death of a Laterano citizen serving as the chief executive of a city state guard unit. And the fourth item nearly caused a war... 

Most of Executor's mission record is like this. 
It is clear that the Notarial Hall deploys its executors only to the most challenging of missions.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Operator Executor is a man slow to speak, who rarely smiles. The people of Rhodes Island have long understood this. 
It is also widely believed that Executor lacks common sense, but such an assertion would need to first be scientifically demonstrated. Human resources does not accept such biased evaluations. 
Executor has indicated that his problem is not that he does not understand the facts, rather that he does not understand the meaning that others attribute to them. Our studies have shown that Executor's lack of empathic ability is not illustrative of psychopathic tendencies, rather it indicates a sort of mechanical absorption of information, with an overstimulated nervous system reaching similar conclusions. Adding more information to his mind does not result in the formation of secondary conceptions. 
Of course, the medical operators responsible for examination of Executor's brain activity have not yet reached a consensus. 
A small number of operators suspect that Executor is not in fact human, but rather a humanoid robot spy sent by Closure. Closure has denied such charges, but she too believes that Executor is not a human being. 
For his part, Executor has never responded to the rumors. He just silently accepts his tasks and completes them whenever he is told "this is a task that should be prioritized."
Naturally, he puts his Notarial tasks first. 
Such is the origin of his name: he decisively eliminates all obstacles and executes the will of the Laterano citizenry. The Executor.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
[Classified Log] 
Executor gave me the incorrect impression that Laterano's laws exist not only as statutes. Indeed, it is true that the Notarial Hall comprises one piece of the Laterano legal apparatus, and the executors attest to an important fact: Laterano takes its responsibility to its citizens very seriously, treating it as a binding contract. 
But the Laterano people's adherance to the law, or even fear of it, goes behind an executor's power to instill. 
I speak not of the power of religion. The political entities founded on deeply held beliefs go beyond Laterano alone, and the uniqueness of their citizenry cannot be attributed to piety or self-discipline alone. 
This is also not to say that executors, including Executor, are not themselves strong. Last week, I saw him tear out the aorta of a vicious beast with his bare hands, spraying his partner with blood. That was not the first time an operator came crying to me that "Executor is terrifying," and it certainly won't be the last. 
But for the hands of its few lawyers, executors, wandering judges, and the Pope himself, Laterano can do little more than proclaim that the law must be followed. 
In addition to its temporal statutes, Laterano must have another, higher order of law that we cannot perceive. Rather than saying the executor is one piece of the Laterano legal apparatus, it would be more appropriate to say that the executor is the physical manifestation that Laterano created to befit the name of the law. At least that's my opinion. 

All I want to know is what Executor meant by "the statute that takes effect once a shot is fired". Given what he said, I have to wonder if this "law" might be some kind of Originium Art. 
This is the first time I have ever seen Kal'tsit at a loss for words. She appeared to have something to say, but turns and left with a cold laugh. The whole time we were discussing Laterano law, she kept a hand over her mouth and an eyebrow raised. It was really odd. 
I hope my curiosity hasn't gotten us in trouble. 

--Caster Operator L.A.O.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
"You really want him? Think it over. Everyone in the dorm has told you how bad he is!"
"Why do you guys want to get in the way of my happy future with him? It doesn't matter what he's like now, I believe in the power of love!"
"He doesn't think about intimacy like you do. He's such a glass-half-empty kind of guy. It makes you want to give up..."
"You guys are a bunch of cowards. Just get out of my way and let me give it a shot! How do you even know he's that kind of person?"
"I know! Everybody here knows!"
"Huh?"
"Hey."
"Spit it out, one of you did something. Who was it?!"
"Um, her. Her. Her. Her."
"What about you?"
"I... I just took him out for a drink. Nothing else. Really."
"......"
"......"
"So everybody here did it?! I'm the odd man out here?!"
"I mean he helped fix the backup systems, it was really hot..."
"So that's it? Give up?"
"We all gave up."

--Dialog from a certain engineering operators' dormitory.
stories.unLockString: Promote to Elite 2 for more info

stories.storyText:
[Codename] Vermeil
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 2 years
[Place of Birth] Unknown
[Date of Birth] June 25
[Race] Vulpo
[Height] 153cm
[Infection Status] 
Originium crystals visible on skin, confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skills] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Vermeil's place of birth remains unknown. She was in the wilderness outside Siracusa prior to joining Rhodes Island. We speculate that she was a hunter. She demonstrates extraordinary skill in the fields of hunting, sniping, and guerrilla warfare. 
She currently serves Rhodes Island on a sniper team, providing force protection and sharpshooting assistance.

Imaging tests reveal blurry outlines of this operator's internal organs, clouded with abnormal dark spots. Her circulatory system shows an abnormally high rate of Originium particulate matter, with other signs of Oripathy infection, we can confirm that the operator is indeed Infected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 5%
Operator Vermeil's skin has begun to crystallize.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density]0.3u/L
Operator Vermeil's infection has been stabilized.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Operator Vermeil's specific place of birth remains unknown. We know only that it is somewhere under the control of Siracusa and suffers rather few Catastrophes. 
It is difficult to produce a unified, competitive entity in the wilderness. These sorts of things tend to come out of settlements. Although settlements can see their loose alliances broken down by respective interests, they remain close to each other and keep a similar pace of life. 
Vermiel was for the most part a hunter. She hunted animals in the wilderness, collecting junk and other items along the way, to trade in settlements on the edge of the wilderness. She was willing to take all kinds of compensation, assuming the price was fair. Long before the nomadic cities kicked off the modern era, tribal disputes and resource competition spurred conflict in the wilderness for thousands of years, as different groups moved in, changed, merged, and disappeared. 
Vermeil's cloak was handmade, a special product of a settlement called Vermeil. The cloak bears the pattern insignia of the town. It helps block the sun and sand. Hand-crafted and finely woven with excellent craftsmanship from locally-grown materials, these cloaks are a local specialty often sold or given as gifts to guests of Vermeil.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Vermeil does not shy away from the topic of losing her companions. According to her own account, the settlement she belonged to had a dispute with an Ursus mercenary group deep in the wilds of Siracusa. That dispute ultimately escalated to the use of force, resulting in the near extermination of the settlement. With the Siracusan government lacking control over (and interest in) the wilderness, the bloody affair was not recorded and soon forgotten. 
As Vermeil was still young at the time of the incident, the Ursus spared her, but she could not forgive the mercenaries. 
Over the next three years, Vermeil abandoned her name and began to prepare everything she would need to exact her revenge. But found herself seriously injured and knocked unconscious by a wild beast. Fortunately, she was rescued by an elderly hunter passing by. In order to save her life, she had no choice but to give up her wounded arm. When Vermeil awakened and realized the position she was in, she devoted herself to a quick recovery. She overcame her pain, and rapidly adapted to the use of her prosthetic. 
Vermeil continued to hunt her goal, down the path of revenge. The only one she spared was an elderly mercenary, long since retired, surrounded by children and grandchildren. She took only his left arm and a medal symbolizing his honor as a mercenary, sparing his life. At this point, Vermeil has suspended her retaliation against the Ursus.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Like many Infected, Vermeil does not know how she came to acquire the disease, nor does she have any knowledge or understanding of Oripathy. At first, she only had a mix of truth and untruths she picked up from a few people who had previously come into contact with the Infected. Not knowing how to deal with the disease, she chose to endure the pain, just as she had endured the pain of losing her arm before. Pain is pain, she assumed. 
The number of Infected increased day by day, and the term "Infected" seemed to be on everyone's lips. It was only when others began to notice Vermeil's disease that things began to change. Rumors of Oripathy and fear of the Infected gradually evolved into persecution and expulsion. Vermeil lost all ability to handle the situation, overcome with the pain of her disease. 
But Vermeil did not have any special opinion about her disease. She treated it as just another one of life's difficulties that couldn't be avoided. Even as she became known as Infected, even as she was discriminated against, she did not begrudge those who mistrusted her. She just avoided them. 
If she could find a cure, she would go to it. If she couldn't, she would endure it until she couldn't walk. Just as she accepted the loss of her arm, Vermeil accepted herself as an Infected.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info

stories.storyText:
Regarding Operator Vermeil's prosthetic, after some repair and inspection, it became clear that this particular model does not match any commercially available products from its supposed region. Tangentially, though I would prefer not to say too much, it was a certain individual from the Laterano Notarial Hall who led Vermeil to Rhodes Island, and who at a certain point signed a cooperation agreement with Rhodes Island, and who works for Rhodes Island as an operator. 
Taking into account the information we needed to maintain Vermeil's prosthetic, we made several inquiries. Unexpectedly, the result of our inquiries came back to reveal that a Laterano mechanic was living in the mountain forests of Siracusa, pretending to be a local huntsman. The name of the mechanic matched that on a check covering Vermeil's medical bills. Although she herself has chosen to keep silent about her savior, she has always demonstrated great respect and admiration for Laterano people. 
Since the operator herself has not been willing to reveal the details, let us leave this story buried in Vermeil's memory. That may be for the best.
stories.unLockString: Improve Trust to check more info
